body_html:
Thanks. Nevertheless I think that there should be the option to extend the enumeration. I do not want to have several of my fusions labelled with the same token.

For instance, I have the reduce_window+divide, and also a convolution+add. If I fuse them both to something called 'kOutput' then when I am lowering the graph later, how do I tell one from the other?

Also - if this is the case, why does GPU backward convolution get to have a specially named op? It is merely a conv followed by an optional transpose...

  //        activations  gradients
  //              \         /
  //               v       v
  //              Convolution
  //                 conv
  //                   |
  //                   v
  //               Transpose (optional if identity transposition)
